item.title: Need help with .int file please (will be easy if someone uses PI server)

@sk8rdude461 wrote:

wayo0o:

oh yeah, you misunderstand me basically i just need to know how to change there holding boxes like shield not in main weapon hand and so on

The misunderstanding was because you called them ints.

What you just asked for, is changing the wield slot of an item.

http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/google/tutorials/301201-pi-fixing-incorrect-item-slots.html

item.title: Need help with .int file please (will be easy if someone uses PI server)
item.dc:creator: @wayo0o wayo0o
item.description:
@wayo0o wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:2, topic:550239”]We don’t use a file that has an extension of “.int”

We call these “ints” because, if you can’t tell, there’s a bunch of numbers there.

And ints for every model is different.
What works with rune boots may not work with dragon boots. It depends on a few variables.

When making ints it’s a game of guess and check, really.

Use the comments below to help you make new ints for other items:

case 19941:// The item ID itemDef.modelid = 76016;// The Drop model (what you see on the ground) itemDef.name = "Giants Blade";// Item name itemDef.description = "Only the strong can weild this blade." + itemDef.name;// The item description. itemDef.modelZoom = 2050;// How zoomed the inventory model is. itemDef.modelRotationY = 222;// Inventory model rotation on Y axis. itemDef.modelRotationX = 1958;// Inventory model rotation on X axis. itemDef.modelOffset1 = 0;// Inventory model offset Up and Down (I believe, could be opposite) itemDef.modelOffset2 = -28;// Inventory model offset Left and Right (I believe, could be opposite) itemDef.anInt165 = 76016;// I believe this is male wield model itemDef.anInt200 = 76017;// I believe this is female wield model itemDef.groundActions = new String[5];// The ground actions array. itemDef.groundActions[2] = "Take";// The "pickup" action. itemDef.itemActions = new String[5];// The inventory actions array itemDef.itemActions[1] = "Wear";// The "Equip" action. itemDef.itemActions[4] = "Drop";// The "Drop" action break;

Note:
The two actions on the bottom need to be in slots 1 and 4. That’s why I said “Equip” and not “Wear”, because that is the action that is used in the Equip item packet. Same for drop, but the drop item packet.[/quote]

oh yeah, you misunderstand me basically i just need to know how to change there holding boxes like shield not in main weapon hand and so on

Read full topic
item.source: Need help with .int file please (will be easy if someone uses PI server)

item.title: Need help with .int file please (will be easy if someone uses PI server)
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

We don’t use a file that has an extension of “.int”

We call these “ints” because, if you can’t tell, there’s a bunch of numbers there.

And ints for every model is different.
What works with rune boots may not work with dragon boots. It depends on a few variables.

When making ints it’s a game of guess and check, really.

Use the comments below to help you make new ints for other items:

case 19941:// The item ID itemDef.modelid = 76016;// The Drop model (what you see on the ground) itemDef.name = "Giants Blade";// Item name itemDef.description = "Only the strong can weild this blade." + itemDef.name;// The item description. itemDef.modelZoom = 2050;// How zoomed the inventory model is. itemDef.modelRotationY = 222;// Inventory model rotation on Y axis. itemDef.modelRotationX = 1958;// Inventory model rotation on X axis. itemDef.modelOffset1 = 0;// Inventory model offset Up and Down (I believe, could be opposite) itemDef.modelOffset2 = -28;// Inventory model offset Left and Right (I believe, could be opposite) itemDef.anInt165 = 76016;// I believe this is male wield model itemDef.anInt200 = 76017;// I believe this is female wield model itemDef.groundActions = new String[5];// The ground actions array. itemDef.groundActions[2] = "Take";// The "pickup" action. itemDef.itemActions = new String[5];// The inventory actions array itemDef.itemActions[1] = "Wear";// The "Equip" action. itemDef.itemActions[4] = "Drop";// The "Drop" action break;

Note:
The two actions on the bottom need to be in slots 1 and 4. That’s why I said “Equip” and not “Wear”, because that is the action that is used in the Equip item packet. Same for drop, but the drop item packet.

Read full topic
item.source: Need help with .int file please (will be easy if someone uses PI server)

item.title: Need help with .int file please (will be easy if someone uses PI server)
item.dc:creator: @wayo0o wayo0o
item.description:
@wayo0o wrote:

just wondering if anyones got some .int files for

shield, head, body, leg and boots please need them in code like this…
this is one i made for sword, not sure its right but it worked 

 case 19941:
		itemDef.modelid = 76016;
		itemDef.name = "Giants Blade";
		itemDef.description = "Only the strong can weild this blade." + itemDef.name;
        itemDef.modelZoom = 2050;
        itemDef.modelRotationY = 222;
        itemDef.modelRotationX = 1958;
        itemDef.modelOffset1 = 0;
        itemDef.modelOffset2 = -28;
		itemDef.anInt165 = 76016;
		itemDef.anInt200 = 76017;
        itemDef.groundActions = new String[5];
        itemDef.groundActions[2] = "Take";
        itemDef.itemActions = new String[5];
        itemDef.itemActions[1] = "Wear";
        itemDef.itemActions[4] = "Drop";
	break;

Read full topic
item.source: Need help with .int file please (will be easy if someone uses PI server)
